text: Hanford Row, Wimbledon, 2016 Hanford Row is a Grade II listed row of six terraced houses set back from the west side of Wimbledon Common, Wimbledon, London, that was built in the 1760s. These six labourers' cottages were named after their builder, William Hanford, a London businessman. The steep mansard roofs with dormer windows were a later addition. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Grade II listed buildings in the London Borough of Merton Category:Houses completed in 1770 Category:Houses in the London Borough of Merton Category:Grade II listed houses in London
title: Hanford Row
